I wear it when I want to relax, when I want to rest my nose from all that olfactory overload, from all the noise. Its an oasis of peace and introspection. I absolutely love it and never let me down</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1907768"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1907768#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1903007" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1903007" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="engsaam"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1475434"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1475434.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="engsaam" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1903007ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1903007" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1475434">engsaam</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-15">08/15/23 15:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Why 99.9% of this brand are too weeeeeaaak</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1903007"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1903007#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1900167" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1900167" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AMajeedQT"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/30910"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.30910.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AMajeedQT" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Korloff-Paris/Rose-Oud-52106.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52106.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rose Oud"title="Rose Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1900167ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1900167" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/30910">AMajeedQT</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-12">08/12/23 05:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sandalwood and Fig Leaf.<br />
<br />
Tam Dao EDP has one of the most realistic sandalwood smell: softly woody, deep, slightly bitter and earthy. That note is lightened with a lightly-fruity and green note of fig leaf. Not too fruity, sweet, nor juicy. That "fig leaf" I'm smelling could be the cedar/amberwood/vanilla mix. Could be.<br />
<br />
Woody, lightly spicy, very sandalwoody, slightly green and fruity, earthy, natural-smelling.<br />
<br />
I understand the hype, as this is somewhat unique and non-offensive. Especially on men, this softly woody scent would be charming. I also see similarities at the drydown to Diptyque's other most popular fragrance Philosykos, especially that figgy base.<br />
<br />
Personally, I like it. I am not wowed by it after all the hype but I still do like it.<br />
<br />
Neutral-to-cool weather wear, leans masculine with its woodiness.<br />
<br />
"Like"</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1900167"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1900167#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1897256" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1897256" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rosa silvestre"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1777465"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1777465.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="rosa silvestre" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1897256ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1897256" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1777465">rosa silvestre</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-08">08/08/23 14:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I get great longevity (7+ hours on skin) from this, one of the best from Diptyque for that, but unfortunately the coriander comes out on my skin during the dry down and smells a little like body odor. I enjoyed this during the first few hours before some of the other notes begin fading, leaving the coriander exposed.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1897256"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1897256#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1894822" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1894822" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="juicelizard"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1803628"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1803628.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="juicelizard" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1894822ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1894822" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1803628">juicelizard</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-05">08/05/23 08:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>In the opening I pick up some other notes, but essentially this dries down to one extremely dry cedar note. Please don't spray this anywhere near your nose, because it will make you cough. It's not a bad fragrance. I wear it every now and then, but most of the time I prefer fragrances with more complexity.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1894822"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1894822#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1891410" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1891410" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ozymandyias"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1570374"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ozymandyias" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1891410ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1891410" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1570374">ozymandyias</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-31">07/31/23 18:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Can someone tell me how heavy/noticeable is the ginger note in this?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; Very dry, but clean.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1889024"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1889024#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1886380" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1886380" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PeopleTent"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1208922"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1208922.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PeopleTent" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1886380ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1886380" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1208922">PeopleTent</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-24">07/24/23 22:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love this, my chalky goodness. Love at first smell and to it for it I hold it in high regard.<br />
<br />
I'm a bypass the theatrics and say all I'm getting from this is some cold weather wearable writing chalk that becomes slighty sweet progressively through the wearing on skin and I can see how some people are getting ancient smoke at a Buddhist temple vibes from this because the look of some Asians faces when they get a wiff of this. Like they are thinking to themselves like really and I'm thinking in response, yeah really, lol.<br />
Overall, it's slightly sneeze inducing for me but it's long lasting, quality, perfectly linear in scent profile and the biggest plus is that it's a unisex sent that doesn't have to me that perfume smell. Good stuff.<br />
Oh and let me add that point if veiw might only make since to a percentage of people because I seek no complements, likes, balloons or any since of surrendering to the pressure of conformity.<br />
As long as everyone is not saying that I smell bad and I like the smell. Then it's full steam ahead or shall I say, full application ahead.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1886380"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1886380#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1880400" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; The amber and vanilla combined with the sandalwood attribute to the smooth creamy experience.<br />
The projection sits closer to the skin, which makes it a more personalized experience.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1855327"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1855327#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1854379" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; But I love it!!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1849795"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1849795#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1843213" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1843213" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Presentscents"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1621761"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1621761.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Presentscents" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Tempo-Eau-de-Parfum-48680.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48680.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tempo Eau de Parfum"title="Tempo Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1843213ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1843213" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1621761">Presentscents</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-27">05/27/23 17:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Subtle creamy sandalwood. I especially like the opening with coriander, ginger, and lots of pepper. Unfortunately that doesnt last long and it just dries down to a very subtle skin scent of sandalwood cedar and lime.The sandalwood here is slightly incensey and I was surprised to see the lime stay top to base.  I think this is a very classy, well blended and meditative scent but definitely not worth the price regarding its performance. I nearly used all of my 2mL decant to only be left with a skin scent 15 minutes later. I cant say the scent here is beautiful enough to justify its $200+ price tag.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1843213"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1843213#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1808692" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1808692" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="iniodar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1195159"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1195159.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="iniodar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/Mefisto-Gentiluomo-52432.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52432.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mefisto Gentiluomo"title="Mefisto Gentiluomo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1808692ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1808692" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1195159">iniodar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-14">04/14/23 09:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Blind bought this fragrance at Malpensa Airport, and I have to say that the performance is kind of... lamentable. Especially given the price. The fragrance itself is actually... adequate. I agree that this can smell like pencil shaving. I really wish that the performance could be better. Price to performance ratio, regrettably, I have to say it's way overpriced. Maybe just save your money to buy something like Frederic Malle or Tom Ford.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1808692"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1808692#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1801175" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1801175" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="valeavy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1639387"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1639387.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="valeavy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/BORNTOSTANDOUT/Drunk-Saffron-78857.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78857.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Drunk Saffron"title="Drunk Saffron"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1801175ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1801175" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1639387">valeavy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-05">04/05/23 09:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This completely disappears on me, as if i doused myself with pure water. Disappointing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1801175"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1801175#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1779094" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1779094" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tanaC"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/75237"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.75237.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tanaC" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1779094ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1779094" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/75237">tanaC</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-09">03/09/23 08:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>(Blind buy, 30827119, November 2019 batch)<br />
<br />
I blind buy this after I am interested in a sort of pure woody scent.<br />
I prefer it slightly dry, coarse texture and woody fragrance with a spicy/green nuance.<br />
After I enjoy Bois Marocain (2022), It's Cedre - Cypress - Spicy to the maximum.<br />
<br />
While this is not hit me as I wish (I believe Tam Dao EDT might be more suitable for my liking). This is still quite a good scent.<br />
<br />
Lime aspect is strong here (Amouage Lyric Man), fresh green lime but not very citrusy but realistic enough.<br />
And I do also mildly pick up the smell of Coriander leaf in the opening quite easily.<br />
<br />
These 2 ingredients really remind me of local basil leaves here in Thailand.<br />
Which provides both Greeny, Zingy and Limey aspects to the fragrance.<br />
<br />
Later, develops into the most Creamy Sandalwood that I ever meet.<br />
It do still provide a Woody feel, but It's not powdery as other Sandalwood I tried at all.<br />
 (that I can pick up powdery Sandalwood like BLV Homme and Noir Femme)<br />
<br />
And the scent does remain there until the end of its life, it is a bit less citrusy - spicy as time fast by.<br />
But eventually, the scent fades out as a whole. <br />
It doesn't feel like Real Wood or Insence in South East Asia culture.<br />
<br />
But I can only assume that this should probably smell like Sandalwood as a refined ingredient. The closest Sandalwood smell that feels like this probably be Amouage Reflection (but that one is still little tiny bit powdery).<br />
<br />
I have a hard time giving a score to this one.<br />
It smells too refined for my kind of Woody fragrance.<br />
<br />
I will leave this 6-9/10 for now as a first impression, I will get back to this to see I like it more or not. I can't really finalize the score now.<br />
<br />
Projection : Low - Intimate<br />
Longivity : 5-6 hours. (Edit on Longevity, I think this scent quite last 8 hours post wear I still smell it faintly, but it quite close to skin. - Let's classify this one as More close to the skin)<br />
<br />
(I might try layer with JML English Oak &amp; Hazelnut to see rather I can make it bit more coarse)<br />
=====<br />
Edit 1 : Mar 14, 2023<br />
<br />
I would say less is more for this fragrance.<br />
This wears more like 2nd skin.<br />
<br />
And if the Creamiest Sandalwood is what are you looking for, go blind buy Tam Dao EDP.<br />
<br />
I will leave this 8/10. <br />
It do smell great.<br />
=====<br />
Edit 2 : Apr 14, 2023<br />
<br />
I do sniff comparison between EDT and EDP and I just notice something interesting.<br />
<br />
I find EDP has mild latonic feel (very mild, creamy) that why I mention it is creamiest sandalwood, and slight faint of Balsamic quality. <br />
<br />
I think after wear both side by side, for best experience of Tam Dao, go for EDP.<br />
<br />
And no, this one is not layer well with other fragrance. When you wear EDP it is time for enjoy the scent of itself.<br />
<br />
9/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1779094"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1779094#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1773523" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1773523" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MuralGlobe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555623"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1555623.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MuralGlobe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Fleur-d-Oranger-27-6331.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6331.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fleur d'Oranger 27"title="Fleur d'Oranger 27"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1773523ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1773523" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555623">MuralGlobe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-02">03/02/23 19:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Utterly woody, creamy, and everything in between. Kidding, it's not that complex, but it also kind of is. And even if you don't love the smell, buy the bottle for the bottle. The art with the little elephant really does it for me.<br />
<br />
I want to call this linear. I really do. If there is lime, vanilla, and ginger in here then I cannot smell it. And if I'm not meant to smell it, they do a darn good job at making the sandalwood diva sparkle and shine in the LIMElight (hehe). It actually reminds me of this storage room behind the organ in the chapel at my university (the instrument, y'all). This immense woody smell, cultivated in a dark and dry room with no airflow and no visitors. It's like, one of the most comforting things you could encounter with your nose-- nostalgic, even.<br />
<br />
There are SO many wood fragrances in the world, each with their own feminine or masculine twists. Sandalwood, gaiac wood, cedar, and all those lovely trees play a role in the supporting cast, building the proper foundation for both niche and designer. They really don't get the credit they deserve. Tam Dao is one of the perfumes that has the woods play the leading role, and absolutely killing it. It makes me tear up just how natural and in-their-element they feel playing such a big role. There is no masculine darkness and spice to this, nor is there a sweetness or brightness that takes away from the brooding nature of nature. <br />
<br />
Full disclosure, I actually do get bored with Tam Dao. I also get bored with Santal 33, Another 13, and basically any fragrance. Must be some mental illness of mine, or maybe it's MY nature. But pulling out this bottle when I have an inevitable craving... is just delectable. Scent 9/10, longevity is actually really poor for me on skin AND on clothes. Dare I say the longevity is 5/10 (yikes). Bottle makes up for it. 10/10 bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1773523"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1773523#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1769149" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1769149" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="interwebarachnid"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1399507"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1399507.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="interwebarachnid" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1769149ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1769149" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1399507">interwebarachnid</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-25">02/25/23 12:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Exceptionally understated and complex perfume. Now, this is not by any means a loud, room filling, bold scent. Its quietly beautiful, with a certain sophistication I haven't smelt from most perfumes. This perfume feels like opening an antiquated wooden box to unveil some ornate golden treasure, filtered dust-mote-filled light creeping its way into the box for the first time in innumerable decades. Its creamy, undulating wood with some fresh floral nuances giving it a very atmospheric, almost watery undertone-- not as in aquatic or fresh, but rather a mossy cobblestone creek adjacent to a dilapidated church. Extremely introspective, nuanced, and intelligent perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1769149"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1769149#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1758886" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1758886" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="negrowhite"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1682231"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1682231.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="negrowhite" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1758886ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1758886" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1682231">negrowhite</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-13">02/13/23 05:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The feeling of pure wood. I love sandalwood</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1758886"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1758886#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1758881" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1758881" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hijoebye"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1323365"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1323365.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="hijoebye" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1758881ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1758881" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1323365">hijoebye</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-13">02/13/23 05:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a sandlewood forward fragrance that has a bit of spiciness to it. I also detect some peppery smokiness and I swore that it had chocolate undertones at the first spray. The coriander for me is quite noticeable also. I have to agree with others here that say they feel "something is missing" from this one -- this is the same impression I got. It doesn't change much througout the dry down, which is fine, but I also feel there's a lack of personality not to mention the longevity wasn't great for me after 2 sprays. I ultimately went with Orphon as I felt it was more intricate with depth, lasted much longer and projected better.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1758881"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1758881#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1758239" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1758239" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alaspoorwho"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1463915"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1463915.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alaspoorwho" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/D-R-Harris/Sandalwood-Cologne-41269.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41269.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sandalwood Cologne"title="Sandalwood Cologne"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1758239ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1758239" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1463915">alaspoorwho</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-12">02/12/23 05:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm goign to refrain from reviewing this because, as someone else mentioned in their review, I'm pretty sure I'm anosmic to some major ingredient! With a couple sprays I can smell something like those dusty organge peanut chew candies, but only if I press my nose directly against where I'd applied it. If I focus I can pick up some of that faint, tart citrus note, but mostly I'm getting a very faint soapy, clean smell. My firends confirm that they detect much more than I can. This is the first time I've experienced this!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1758239"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1758239#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1752883" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1752883" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ofaruk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1564484"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1564484.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ofaruk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1752883ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1752883" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1564484">Ofaruk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-05">02/05/23 16:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For those who never smelled real sandalwood, Tam Dao would be a great introduction to enter the realm of this enchanted&amp; mysterious wood. <br />
<br />
Please note that this is not your legendary mysore sandalwood. Tam Dao represents cultivated Australian sandalwood with synthetic cypress and iso E Super undertones. For those who know what real mysore sandalwood is, and seeking for a sprayable alternative, please do not waste your time and money, this not for you. <br />
<br />
I think Ajmals Amber Santal is definetely along same lines with Tam Dao, but more potent, longer lasting and has better projection.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1752883"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1752883#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1747757" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1747757" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kushal"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1405583"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kushal" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1747757ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1747757" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1405583">Kushal</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-30">01/30/23 19:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>PEPPERY  , POWDERY &amp; SYNTHETIC SANDALWOOD from start to end . <br />
Its as if the perfumer decided to incorporate all the variants of Sandal Aroma chemicals at once , to give an impression of all the facets there are to this one particular note !<br />
Longevity isn't a problem as it will last for 8-10 hrs on skin , but avoid spraying on clothes , as it will last for a day or two and the experience wont be a pleasurable one.<br />
<br />
Perfect for layering though . Try layering it with citrus colognes .</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1747757"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1747757#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1737206" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1737206" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mejohann"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/196086"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.196086.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mejohann" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lubin/Black-Jade-13013.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.13013.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Jade"title="Black Jade"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1737206ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1737206" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/196086">mejohann</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-18">01/18/23 10:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This was so disappointing. The perfumers used a very cheap grade of cedarwood and it overwhelmed the composition. I adore sandalwood and based on the description and notes of vanilla and ginger, this seemed like it would be a home run for me - a combination of my favorite notes. I had also hoped the quality would be good, low on synthetics, given the price point. Unfortunately the dry cedarwood just pushes away all the notes and steals all the attention. For a moment near the drydown the sandalwood is perceptible, but it vanishes along with everything else. All I got was cedar with something synthetic in there - possibly hedione - giving the smallest touch of water/floral. If you want cedar, this is fairly true-to-life. It smells most similar to Himalayan Cedar rather than the typical Midwestern or Texas Cedar. But if you're hoping for the other notes or for a sandalwood fragrance, this won't do it for you.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1737206"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1737206#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1713515" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1713515" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="windchime_00"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1538994"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1538994.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="windchime_00" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/English-Pear-Freesia-10314.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10314.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="English Pear & Freesia"title="English Pear & Freesia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1713515ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1713515" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1538994">windchime_00</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-20">12/20/22 10:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is the dry dill-pickle sandalwood done right. It draws me in. I also smell vegetation, maybe lemongrass? Also, smelled something a tad nutty to me, when I first tested it. It's both airy high-altitude and warming. <br />
<br />
At first sniff I liked it, but it smelled too green to me and not dark green, but mid to light or yellowish green, but it continues to grow in favor for me and takes a special place. Good scent for feeling grounded, but could also be a unisex going out for certain occasions. In other words, it's natural smelling, but not too niche where you are limited with it and the impressions it can give. I see it ideally as a high-quality meditative fall scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1713515"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1713515#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1713087" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1713087" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PJ_Noir"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1591153"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1591153.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PJ_Noir" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/BDK-Parfums/Gris-Charnel-57038.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57038.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gris Charnel"title="Gris Charnel"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1713087ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1713087" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1591153">PJ_Noir</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-19">12/19/22 19:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance smells like an old Buick rotting away in the woods of the Pacific Northwest. I love fragrances that fall squarely in the unisex category and this one is a little more masculine than that.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1713087"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1713087#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1709980" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1709980" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="snifftacular"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1595238"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1595238.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="snifftacular" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ormonde-Jayne/Ormonde-Man-4931.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4931.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ormonde Man"title="Ormonde Man"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1709980ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1709980" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1595238">snifftacular</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-15">12/15/22 12:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tam Dao is a creamy and peaceful sandalwood scent that sits close to your skin, is kinda forgettable, but one that you find yourself reaching for because you don't feel like wearing a strong scent this day. I would say that it is masculine, cerebral, meditative, and calming. There is definitely something very Zen about this fragrance. It could easily stunt double as a room spray. Some other commenter mentioned that Diptyque is an unintentional elite room spray maker when what they are really trying to do is make perfumes. That was funny, but it resonated with me. <br />
<br />
This fragrance reminds me of a showroom for very high quality wood furniture, that are handmade with a lot of care. One just sits and reflects. <br />
<br />
The sandalwood is very linear and forward, and for the first hour you can sense the olfactory mistake of coriander and lime jump out as well. This is interesting because it creates an almost rose-oud accord that made me ask if there was oud in here, but there isn't. That twist does fade in and out in the course of 15 minutes of wear, leaving just a creamy, dry and somewhat vegetal sandalwood. <br />
<br />
Projection and longevity, as is typical of Diptyque, are weak. It projects for about one hour within arms length (EDP version) and then settles down to a skin scent that lasts for another 2-3 hours, and then by hour 4-5 is completely gone. For $150 for 75ml I was expecting more, especially for the EDP. Numbers like that you'd expect from a weaker EDT. I can't even imagine how ephemeral and fleeting the EDT of this is. <br />
<br />
To me, this frag seems almost unfinished. There's something missing, and one must keep spraying it to get to the bottom of the mystery. Perhaps Tam Dao is like a Zen koan in the form of a fragrance. The fragrance itself points to an absence, the void of which the individual must fill in a moment of satori. In that moment it all makes sense, despite all the mysticism and absurdity it took to get there. <br />
<br />
This is a solid 8/10.<br />
<br />
EDIT: <br />
<br />
Just layered this with Penhaligon's Babylon, and it is AMAZING! The creaminess of Tam Dao with the woody, spicy vanilla of Babylon is insanely good. Try it if you have both!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1709980"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1709980#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1706492" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1706492" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="QuincesI"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1589519"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1589519.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="QuincesI" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1706492ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1706492" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1589519">QuincesI</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-10">12/10/22 17:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>So I prefer this version of the EDP to the EDT, which I also wore for a long time with pleasure. I think this EDP is denser, spicier, woodier, and less vegetal. The two are very similar, overall, although I read more sandalwood in this one.<br />
<br />
In retrospect, however, I agree: it's linear, almost a little cold, and lacks a tiny bit of soul, but it's one of those industrially produced scents that I have no qualms about spraying a little too much everywhere, nor seeing it run out a little too fast. Perhaps the only Diptyque I'd take to a desert island, then - but mostly for its cuddly feel.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1706492"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1706492#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1705582" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1705582" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="linteresa35"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1575983"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="linteresa35" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Lazy-Sunday-Morning-20542.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.20542.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lazy Sunday Morning"title="Lazy Sunday Morning"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1705582ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1705582" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1575983">linteresa35</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-09">12/09/22 12:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't really know what I feel about this scent. It's love hate for me. The first time I smelt it, I loved it so much and I could not stop thinking about it. It is a woodsy scent that is so inviting and not overwhelming. It's a bit hard to explain. I smelt it a few times and I continued to love it so I purchased it. I'm not sure why, but I started smelling a strong bacon note in it. The top notes for me were VERY smoking and bacon like... but not in a good way. I felt like I was just smelling someone barbequing. It goes away after a few minutes but I really am not a fan of that smell. It also started to become a bit creamy and really green... I'm not sure if my nose is playing tricks on me but I am not smelling what I fell in love with. When I get whiffs of this perfume when it's on me, it's amazing and I love it so much but if I bring nose to wrist and smell this perfume with intent, it smells different to me and is almost nauseating. I still love the perfume nonetheless. Perhaps just need to figure out where to spray it on my body so that the scent doesn't overwhelm me too much.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1705582"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1705582#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1705022" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1705022" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lynxonacactus"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1618532"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1618532.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lynxonacactus" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1705022ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1705022" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1618532">lynxonacactus</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-08">12/08/22 15:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells like raw, unshelled peanuts immediately after hitting my skin. It then transforms into a creamy, wood-sy scent that reminds me of cedar boxes</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1705022"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1705022#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1700413" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1700413" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kaiaoh"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1397309"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="kaiaoh" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1700413ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1700413" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1397309">kaiaoh</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-02">12/02/22 03:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p><br />
 22</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1700413"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1700413#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1696180" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
