padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1696180" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jeff Shin"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1336585"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1336585.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jeff Shin" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Houbigant/Iris-des-Champs-28138.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.28138.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Iris des Champs"title="Iris des Champs"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1696180ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1696180" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1336585">Jeff Shin</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-25">11/25/22 22:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of the drier sandalwoods on the market. At first, I really thought this smelled like standing in a dry sauna. I hoped it would be creamier and smoother but this instead gave me an image of a hot, dry sandalwood chip. Quite realistic and calming but I've smelt better sandalwoods. Projection is soft and longevity is average, but the dry down that you can smell when you sniff your skin closely is divine. A frag where skin testing is absolutely needed.<br />
<br />
Compared to the EDT, I find this EDP to be more long-lasting but has a softer scent throw. More winter appropriate and less diverse. If I have a choice, I'd go for this version.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1696180"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1696180#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1695037" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1695037" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Farrque"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1201583"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1201583.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Farrque" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Indemodables/Ambre-Supreme-70274.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70274.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ambre Suprme"title="Ambre Suprme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1695037ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1695037" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1201583">Farrque</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-24">11/24/22 02:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells of pure, clean cedarwood in the opening, that is to say without the pungency or 'sweaty' tone some varieties houses. <br />
Gets darker after 30 minutes or so with clean incense smoke, black pepper, fir and moss. <br />
Never truly derails from being a pure cedarwood scent so you could call it monotonous but I think that's the whole charm of the fragrance. <br />
Lovely, if not overly simple.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1695037"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1695037#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1691965" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1691965" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="KenanC_C"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1612548"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1612548.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="KenanC_C" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1691965ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1691965" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1612548">KenanC_C</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-19">11/19/22 14:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have a sample size of this fragrance and surprisingly this scent is a solid 7/10. It has a very unique opening scent, it remined me of nuts and chocolate. I showed it to my friends and they all disliked it but it smelt very good to me. This is def more of a mature scent, I rec this scent to people who have a classy vintage style as this fragrance exudes maturity. Please don't wear this scent if your image is more playful and young, it will not fit you as this fragrance really brings out its potential for people who are more grown. If your a person who's quiet, calm, and have a very mysterious vibe this fragrance is for you. VERY RIZZ if the right person is wearing it, if you wore this to a date during the night, your getting the W.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1691965"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1691965#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1677802" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1677802" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kwisdommeister"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1386745"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="kwisdommeister" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1677802ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1677802" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1386745">kwisdommeister</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-31">10/31/22 02:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I sampled the EDT and ended up getting the EDP, based on my experience with Philosykos EDT vs. EDP (I like both, but the EDP performs better). <br />
I find this EDP to have a very sharp woodsy scent, however once that subsides in about 10 minutes or so, it becomes a nice skin scent, I am not much of a connoisseur so cannot tell what it really smells like after the initial sharpness, but definitely more unisex, somewhat sweet. <br />
A dry wood, like firewood??<br />
Update: been wearing it for a week now and I am in love. Santal, real subtle nice Santal incense, pleasantly sweet on me after an hour, but no sugar here or any tackiness. love love love!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1677802"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1677802#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1674025" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1674025" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="likesleet"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1510132"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1510132.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="likesleet" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/HUNQ/004-Lifeguard-69630.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69630.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="#004 Lifeguard"title="#004 Lifeguard"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1674025ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1674025" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1510132">likesleet</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-25">10/25/22 13:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i've smelled this so many times, but this never grasps my attention. powdery wood.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1674025"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1674025#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1663968" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1663968" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ajrose87"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1458804"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1458804.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ajrose87" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1663968ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1663968" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1458804">ajrose87</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-11">10/11/22 16:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tam Dao is the second Diptyque scent I purchased. Right before the Pandemic began full force in March 2020. I remember needing the pick me up. I had sampled this one months before and worn it during an emotional international fling that took me back and forth to Vancouver CA. Needless to say, every time I wore this, I felt in control of the dynamic in that romantic connection -- even if that was not objectively true. This scent exudes maturity through a calming and very dry wear. It's funny that as I've worn it into the present, it's never as spicy as I want it to be, but the lightly sweet/creaminess of the woods always brings me back around to enjoying this fragrance. I don't get as much lime here as much as vanilla, musk, and of course the sandalwood. Whenever the weather turns cool and damp, I turn to Tam Dao to warm me up but not overheat.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1663968"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1663968#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1660226" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1660226" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="b1ad3"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1312264"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1312264.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="b1ad3" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Initio-Parfums-Prives/Side-Effect-42260.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.42260.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Side Effect"title="Side Effect"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1660226ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1660226" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1312264">b1ad3</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-06">10/06/22 08:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sounds like most of the reviews are in line with my take on this one.  Beautiful creamy sandalwood, blended superbly with some dry cedar, and some nice aromatics in coriander and ginger, with just a hint of lime.  I love vanilla as a note, but it is hardly noticeable to me in this one.  I like to rock this one when I am in a more introverted and contemplative mood which suits its soft but mysterious nature.  I find this ultra-relaxing.  This one jumps in and out of my top shelf for fall.  When I wear it, no doubt it is amazing, then I put it on the shelf and almost forget about it...that is...until I wear it again.  And every time it evokes an ethereal peace inside.<br />
<br />
Scent: 4/5<br />
Longevity: 3/5<br />
Sillage: 2/5</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1660226"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1660226#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1659138" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1658880" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="woodfreak"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1583120"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1583120.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="woodfreak" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1658880ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1658880" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); Creamy, spicy, round, fresh, hot, cool radiates confidence and good taste. <br />
Pine, sandalwood, subtle vanilla, spices. <br />
Sillage is ok, longevity is absolute shit. I used to layer it with Zadig This Is Her and now with ELDO Fat Electrician &amp; Mihan Aromatics Kirra Curl. HUGE compliment getter!!! <br />
Stays nicely on clothes, wish it stayed longer on skin. Its a calming cream sauna temple wood. Bye!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1658880"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1658880#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1654270" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Opening is with needles.  Dries into a fairly generic and pleasant woody armoachem scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1654270"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1654270#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1652479" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; very calm but it has a beautiful depth to it<br />
I can see it as an amazing scent to wear during a leisure day at home, fall/spring</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1652479"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1652479#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1648005" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1648005" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Fragrantisizer"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1571363"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Fragrantisizer" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/24/24-Elixir-Ambrosia-43982.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43982.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="24 Elixir Ambrosia"title="24 Elixir Ambrosia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1648005ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1648005" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1571363">Fragrantisizer</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-18">09/18/22 17:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very much less creamy but not sweet. That is misleading. It's green, but unlike the EDT,  the E D T is DEFINITIVELY MORE SWEET/CREAMIER  I think people get the wrong bottles, they keep saying impossible smell profiles. This is definitely more earthy, thinner, skin scent leaning. It smells good, but it is not as robust as the EDT. <br />
<br />
You would think an EDP would last longer than blah  blah but that's so ignorant. have you even purchased a $12 EDT that lasted 12 hours?  Both Last moderately, but the EDT is definitely sweeter and creamier. EDP more Green.<br />
<br />
I love the brand, I remember how badly people ragged on how the scent profiles are weak, low performance etc and now they all suck the D of Diptyque with a classic troll following.<br />
<br />
I highly recommend to take the EDT and EDP as 2 different perfumes and check before you buy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1648005"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1648005#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1647796" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1647796" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="khoi0402"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/140160"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.140160.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="khoi0402" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12192.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Neroli Portofino"title="Neroli Portofino"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1647796ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1647796" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/140160">khoi0402</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-18">09/18/22 11:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm starting to have a spray of Tam Dao on my body regularly at night before sleep to calm my mind. Impeccable cozy woody scent. I love it so much.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1647796"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1647796#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1646251" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1646251" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Arlet"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1301166"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Arlet" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1646251ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1646251" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1301166">Arlet</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-16">09/16/22 05:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This to me reminds me of a way better version of Gypsy Water  - which I think smells great, but its lasting power, at least on my skin is basically .5 milliseconds. Tam Dao is beautiful and versatile - dressed up or down it would work, I've only tried a small sample, but for sure FB worthy.<br />
<br />
EDIT: My husband surprised me with a FB of Tam Dao (EDP) so I had a chance to do some real sprays of Gypsy Water and Tam Dao on opposite forearms. Gypsy Water is warmer and sweeter, while Tam Dao is far dryer and heavy on the woods -  Loads of woods ( the EDT is closer than the EDP to GW if anyone is curious.<br />
 <br />
The opening of Tam Dao (EDP) isn't my favorite part - but once it developed on my skin I really enjoyed the dry down I got (some 20 min in).  It becomes a very soft creamy relaxed sort of vibe from the sandalwood. I get this airy (not aldehydic, but more of a warm breeze carrying some woods) with a warm musk scent. More than anything, I like the scent trail it leaves rather than smelling it directly on my skin. I think I prefer the EDT version of Tam Dao, so I think I'll exchange the parfum. Interestingly, I assumed the EDP would be the same notes as the EDT, turns out they are a bit different in their notes and composition. <br />
<br />
Oh! I sprayed Diptyque's Eau Rose (EDT) fragrance sample on my hand - it's not really my sort of fragrance but once this developed, it was slightly citrusy, clean, and very pretty. When layered together with TD edp and fully dried, it's BEAUTIFUL! Litchi is listed as a top note, so I'm guessing a citrus fragrance or one with Litchi will layer really well if set on top of TD. In any case, worn alone it's very nice. I wouldn't recommend blind buying the EDP version of Tam Dao. It's a very interesting take on woods, but not for everyone.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1646251"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1646251#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1641300" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1304251">flugsang</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-09">09/09/22 01:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Calm, quiet, and really polished. I had to test it again because it's always been on my mind in reading but im leaving this review as a reminder that although it's really nice, it isn't for me :) Completely understand people's meditative associations to it. I wish i could work out to a place with Tam Dao in full blast  It really provides focus and concentration, but as a person i guess at this point in my life that isn't what im looking for in a perfume</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; <br />
Intimate projection and doesnt really last long compared to some of Diptyque Ive tried, but really did its job well at calming my nerves down.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1624719"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1624719#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1621829" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
