padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1540186">ida-nugent</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-11">08/11/22 18:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love! Incensey spiced sandalwood as others have described. Lots of culinary notes with the lime, vanilla(subtle), coriander and ginger. It's not a listed but I definitely get a distinct green peppercorn note. Haven't had it on too long but already getting a creamy delicious skin scent. Could see this working any season.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1621829"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1621829#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1620637" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1620637" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="QuentinsBeach"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1546186"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="QuentinsBeach" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1620637ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1620637" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1546186">QuentinsBeach</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-10">08/10/22 03:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Subtle in all directions. Slightly milky, and slightly dry wood at once, so both ends of the woody spectrum, albeit the drier woods are accentuated by the just hinted lime and ginger sparkle on top - nothing here is overly pronounced. Extremely wearable. A fine balance of fresh, zingy, woody, milky. For me it's all year as anything fresher than this is too fresh for my taste.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1620637"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1620637#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1612709" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1612709" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jerhmie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1541116"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1541116.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jerhmie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1612709ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1612709" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1541116">jerhmie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-29">07/29/22 03:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Diptyque Tam Dao is a fragrance that effortlessly evokes memories of serene moments spent at Jogyesa and Sinheungsa Temples in Korea. Its blend of warm, woody notes takes me back to the peaceful ambiance of these sacred places, where the scent of ancient sandalwood and cedarwood infused the air. <br />
<br />
This fragrance holds a special place in my heart, not just for its evocative power, but also for its versatility. The earthy, yet refined blend makes it suitable for any occasion, whether it's a casual day out or a special evening event. It's my ultimate favorite and has become my signature scent, embodying my love for both nature and elegance. I love how it exudes a sense of sophistication and tranquility while leaving a lasting impression.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1612709"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1612709#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1605365" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1605365" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Inconucopia"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1307201"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1307201.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Inconucopia" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1605365ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1605365" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1307201">Inconucopia</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-18">07/18/22 06:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>sample vial. tran-scent-dental temple scent. <br />
<br />
The sandalwood composition here is just so lovely. reminds me of my childhood in chinese temples and pagodas, where the sandalwood incense burnt is so much tranquil in the upper tiers. <br />
<br />
The actual wearing of the scent is soft, personal and everything i want in a sandalwood fragrance. a friend of mine mentions that the EDT is closer to the temple experience and I will need to try it out to compare. Love love love love love.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1605365"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1605365#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1601130" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1601130" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="likesleet"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1510132"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1510132.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="likesleet" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/HUNQ/004-Lifeguard-69630.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69630.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="#004 Lifeguard"title="#004 Lifeguard"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1601130ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1601130" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1510132">likesleet</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-11">07/11/22 15:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>lime, ginger. powdery wood</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1601130"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1601130#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1590451" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1590451" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="scentedddiary"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1356152"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1356152.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="scentedddiary" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1590451ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1590451" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1356152">scentedddiary</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-24">06/24/22 02:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very specific image comes to mind whenever I smell Tam Dao: visiting a traditional hanok village in korea while snacking on a paper bag full of toasted hazelnuts. Maybe on a chilly day, when it's still early in the morning and there's not many visitors yet, so you can enjoy the little sounds of nature around you. That kind of zen, dry and slightly dusty woody olfactory experience.<br />
My favorite type of scent. Poetic, meditative, introspective. Love love love</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1590451"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1590451#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1589376" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1589376" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BaldBoyBaris"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1517379"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1517379.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="BaldBoyBaris" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Whispers-in-the-Library-53537.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53537.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Whispers in the Library"title="Whispers in the Library"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1589376ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1589376" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1517379">BaldBoyBaris</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-22">06/22/22 11:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>You are walking in a temple which locate on a mountain somewhere in eastern Asia. Old wooden building get the smell of burning incense and sandalwood and amber items in hundreds of years, darkness, dryness, soothing. Some slow wind come inside with a tiny little scent of green. <br />
On my skin it is a little bit too strong and sweet (in lower temperature it will be better). I prefer the EDT version, which is less sweet with more dryness, like that you were in front of the temple and didn't walk in. <br />
Use it before sleep and it can calm you down. Spray after bath for a sawdust-like clean feel<br />
------<br />
<br />
EDT<br />
</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1589376"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1589376#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1585908" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1585908" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sniffathon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1357164"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1357164.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sniffathon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1585908ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1585908" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1357164">Sniffathon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-16">06/16/22 19:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love a good sandalwood and it manages to makes its way as a note in most of my fragrances, but this one is a head scratcher. So many great reviews making me trying to like it more but Im not sure I can. <br />
<br />
Agreeing with others, the opening is harsh and a little unpleasant - I can distinguish strong coriander and ginger and a touch of vanilla amongst the strong pungent woods. Luckily within 5 mins the musky powderiness begins to mellow it out. It becomes softer and warm and much more pleasing, but there is still something about it that I cant put my finger on that makes this smell a little old lady-esque. Perhaps its the vanilla combined with the aromatics that lingers amongst the woods?<br />
<br />
Not sure I like this. I would love to smell it on someone else to make an absolute final decision. I have fallen in love with Matiere Santal Austral and before I bite the bullet Ive been exploring more affordable sandalwood options and although this is decently pleasant it is definitely worth trying before buying.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1585908"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1585908#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1579030" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1579030" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="HorkyBamf"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1508536"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1508536.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="HorkyBamf" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Laboratorio-Olfattivo/ExpLOud-69294.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69294.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="ExpLOud"title="ExpLOud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1579030ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1579030" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1508536">HorkyBamf</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-06">06/06/22 15:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wanted to like this. I tried to like it. The sandalwood is nice enough, the cedar is starting to get into bags of mulch at Home Depot territory but still OK, and the rest of it is just horrid. Way too old-timey perfumey for me. I don't understand all the love this one gets. Had to scrub it off my skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1579030"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1579030#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1557018" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1557018" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="teh"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1371398"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1371398.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="teh" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Pur-Oud-66436.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66436.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pur Oud"title="Pur Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1557018ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1557018" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1371398">teh</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-04">05/04/22 12:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>very iconic very diptyque in the early 2000s where things were made in the most elegant and effortless way you could ever imagine! sadly they dont make scents like this anymore these days - recent creations are mostly money grabs that rather smell (and look) like some random nouveau-riche in the mall anyway Tam Dao is one of the most thoughtful and artistic creations of Diptyque till date! It almost feels like a Nat Geo documentary of Northern Vietnam in a bottle! The lime + coriander opening smells distinctively like a bowl of Pho sold by an old hawker somewhere in a suburbs of Hanoi, where you about to take a day trip to Tam Dao grab a bottle while you can!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1557018"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1557018#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1555604" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1555604" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MandarinOranges"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1490714"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1490714.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MandarinOranges" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Monde-Gourmand/Miel-Bebe-72657.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72657.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Miel Bb"title="Miel Bb"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1555604ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1555604" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1490714">MandarinOranges</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-02">05/02/22 15:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ive been actually holding this off, b/c I wanted to experience the perfume fully before writing a review. It wasnt love at first spray with this one, but now this is in my top three all time favorites. Tam Dao EDP starts off a little harsh, where it smells sort of like spicy tea and  very woody. HOWEVER, once you give itsay 15-30 minutes, it develops into thisextremely unique and creamy sandalwood. This isnt the gas station sandalwood you can find and smell everywhere. This is the sandalwood incense you can only smell from the oldest, almost mythological temples in Asia. You know how you can tell whether a fragrance is warm or not from the scent? Well, Ive never experienced a perfume where it smells cold, celestial, and somewhat aloof until Tam Dao. Its a very creamy, milky, cold, and very, very pure sandalwood. This is the smell that immediately transports me to the ancient temples of Asia. The air inside the temple is brisk, crisp, and cool and still faintly smelling of sandalwood incense. This is my secret reprieve from the bustling outside world. Ive come home. <br />
<br />
Highly recommend. While its not a fragrance that is for everyone, it is one that should be experienced by everyone.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1555604"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1555604#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1551966" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1551966" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Qimmo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1355081"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Qimmo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1551966ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1551966" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1355081">Qimmo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-27">04/27/22 09:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Have you had a vacation lover? Perhaps, somewhere in Southeast Asia. On your last day, you visit a temple together in the middle of a holy forest, and you make a wish there that you'd see each other again, despite all odds. There is incense burning in the background but the air remains crisp.<br />
<br />
Tam Dao is linear. I think the opening is harsh, but eventually gives way to creamy sandalwood. I took a shower and my cuff still smells lightly of it. We're still getting to know each other, but sometimes, Tam Dao smells like pencil shavings. I remember this smell from when I used to sharpen my pencils, again and again, to avoid answering math questions I didn't understand. Sometimes, it also smells like baby powder, the one my mom used to pat me with after a bath, or perhaps even a type of oil she'd rub on me when I was having a stomach ache. It also smells like varnished furniture and the polished wooden floor that I'd lie on that one scorching day I got my heart broken by a high school crush.<br />
<br />
These are different facets of Tam Dao, but I think, ultimately, Tam Dao smells like my trips around Southeast Asia. I remember my first time visiting another Asian country. It was with an older Dutch man. I was uncomfortable there so he took me downtown and explained that the first time he visited Asia, he felt as if he was reborn. Everything was so different. I lost touch with him and then many others, but Asia remains as a picture in my head of elaborate wooden houses with grand overhanging eaves and carved doors, the tea and cuisine they serve there, and also as the noises of clanking wok and indecipherable chatter wafting down the choking alleyways, and now, as a scent. Tam Dao. Wood, but not just any wood. Sacred wood.<br />
<br />
I can't get enough of it. I keep smelling myself, it's like alcohol or spice, allowing me to peer through a dust-coated window, seeing in my mind a time when I was younger, kneeling before a sliding paper door, unsure, trapped in yearning. Wishing to be rescued, but also just hoping to endure.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1551966"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1551966#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1550029" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1550029" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="clairesque"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1347367"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1347367.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="clairesque" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Clean/Skin-35244.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.35244.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Skin"title="Skin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1550029ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1550029" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1347367">clairesque</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-24">04/24/22 15:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I prefer this scent over the EDT - it's a beautiful ode to sandalwood with a delicate balance of sweet vanilla and aromatics. I wouldn't consider it FBW for me because it is slightly masculine-leaning, and although this has more longevity than the EDT it's still not very long-lasting.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1550029"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1550029#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1549208" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1549208" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TonyFragrance"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1479996"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1479996.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TonyFragrance" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1549208ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1549208" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1479996">TonyFragrance</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-23">04/23/22 09:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Best customer service ever from their website. Smells like the woodiest frag you've ever had. Move over Ouds!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1549208"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1549208#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1546128" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1546128" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tolkashutka"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1282717"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1282717.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tolkashutka" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jovoy-Paris/Remember-Me-49435.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49435.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Remember Me"title="Remember Me"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1546128ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1546128" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1282717">Tolkashutka</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-18">04/18/22 17:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I met Tam Dao as the EDT first, and fell head over heels in love.<br />
<br />
This is my first encounter with the EDP, which is very similar to the EDT, but is heavier, longer lasting, and slightly smokier and sharper.<br />
<br />
Normally, heavier potency and lasting power would be my jam, but in this rare instance, I still prefer the EDT, and will end up getting that one as a full bottle at some point.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1546128"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1546128#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1536107" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1536107" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="chrisk252"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1185528"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="chrisk252" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Cerruti/1881-Men-329.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.329.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="1881 Men"title="1881 Men"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1536107ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1536107" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1185528">chrisk252</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-03">04/03/22 13:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Woody, dry, smoky, deep realistic sandalwood without much other notes like spices (like GFT Sandalwood) or Citruses (like Fragonard Santal). Like sticking your face into a pile of sandalwood shavings. I'm comparing the EDP vs EDT. EDT is lighter, less smoky, creamier, and more transparent. <br />
<br />
Completely on a stand alone basis, I might prefer the versatilty of EDT, but I have other lighter sandalwood fragrances (i.e. Fragonard Santal, GFT Sandalwood, etc.), if I was getting a full bottle, I might get the EDP over the EDT. If I had no other sandalwood fragrances, I'd probably get the EDT, which gets me the dry realistic sandalwood without the smokiness with versatiility to wear more often in day or warmer days.<br />
<br />
Scent: 8 / Sillage: 8 / Longevity: 8</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1536107"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1536107#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1516187" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1516187" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="The Wolf"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1263755"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1263755.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="The Wolf" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Bois-D-Argent-48396.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48396.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bois D'Argent"title="Bois D'Argent"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1516187ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1516187" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1263755">The Wolf</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-03">03/03/22 23:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Warning  <br />
<br />
High quality counterfeit Diptyque are circulating online. There is a video on youtube to help you discern real from fake (aside from smell if you are familiar with the particular fragrance). The fake I bought was watery with visible oil separation. <br />
There's a video to help you tell by a Japanese YouTuber with English subtitles.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1516187"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1516187#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1515023" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1515023" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AA4102"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1296849"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1296849.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AA4102" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1515023ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1515023" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1296849">AA4102</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-02">03/02/22 09:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The way I really thought this would be close to GUCCI RUSH  another let down. Oh well,  if you want to smell like a varnished furniture and that sort of things, then Tam Dao is for you.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1515023"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1515023#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1508526" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1508526" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ajrose87"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1458804"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1458804.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ajrose87" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1508526ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1508526" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1458804">ajrose87</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-20">02/20/22 13:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm sure like many others, one of my first purchases from Diptyque after becoming fragrance obsessed was Tam Dao. I remember the first time I smelled this scent. It was on a first date with an attractive Italian I'd never met before. I remember how casually distinguished he smelled. Both creamy, woody and spicy at the same time. Even though I never got around to a second date with said italian, I did follow up with, "what scent were you wearing." Tam Dao was his response. It wasn't until three years later that I had enough cash to warrant purchasing a bottle. I'd in fact received a sample or two prior when I'd opted to splurge on Philosykos as my first Diptyque bottle. Every time I used it -- especially in cold weather -- the dryness of it always soothed me yet was always surprising. to me this is a cold weather scent. It evokes fall and winter and the outdoors. I often times received compliments on this whenever I spray myself and I'm with company. Men and women alike. It doesn't last too long but the hint of it on your clothes after is always so pleasant. The feeling that you're up close and breathing in a freshly cut piece of wood in winter is unmistakable.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1508526"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1508526#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1498888" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1498888" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="thefondest"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1139094"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1139094.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="thefondest" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1498888ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1498888" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1139094">thefondest</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-06">02/06/22 13:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought a full bottle of this years ago with a department store gift card I wasn't sure how to spend. It's easily the most expensive perfume I own, and I don't imagine that changing anytime soon. It's very pleasant, and smells like a comfortable, lived-in home. It's the smell of clean wooden floors and a vanilla candle burning, and I think it's most fitting for cozy nights in. I probably came to associate Tam Dao with that feeling because of how many nights I'd come home to my tiny room after an exhausting day of work in the city, looking for some comfort, luxury, and the reassurance that I was grown up and living well. Wearing it was kind of a way to claim my space, and push against this sense of being caged in a life that didn't quite look how I wanted. It felt good to really spray it on, because it's both inoffensive and expensive enough that I could never imagine spending that much of my own money on a bottle. But it's also a scent that demands spraying on a lot, because it really doesn't project well. That emphasizes the feeling of homegrown intimacy that I associate with this perfume, but it makes me a little less inclined to wear it. Anyone getting a sample of this would likely burn right through it, because it takes a lot of juice to really experience it. A very nice scent I'm grateful to own, but for the price, and how infrequently I wear this, I think an actual candle would be a smarter buy from Diptyque. You could also probably find a similarly woodsy vanilla for much cheaper.<br />
<br />
Thinking about selling my bottle, so DM if you're interested!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1498888"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1498888#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1495859" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1495859" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="DPerfumes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1443109"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="DPerfumes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1495859ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1495859" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1443109">DPerfumes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-01">02/01/22 19:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like a wooden plank. Not in a bad way, but just very linear.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1495859"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1495859#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1495175" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1495175" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MsTwilight"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1386043"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="MsTwilight" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49104.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tam Dao Eau de Parfum"title="Tam Dao Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1495175ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1495175" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1386043">MsTwilight</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-31">01/31/22 20:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is my favourite perfume at the moment that I have discovered and purchased. It makes me feel grounded, serene and confidant. The first couple wears, I thought this was definitely masculine yet I was obsessed with the cypress so that would never bother me. Now I just associate this with pure unisex and maybe even slightly feminine only because I wear it and it sort of adapts in my mind that way. It is just divine.<br />
<br />
It has a smokiness to it but I dont get any sauna vibes as some people have described it.<br />
<br />
The silage is intimate for me at least although I spray max two sprays on clothes. I also like to spray in my hair. When I washed my clothes, and hung them (no fragrance detergent), I would get lovely wifts of it still and be taken aback by how unique and softly subtle it is.<br />
<br />
Although it is more intimate, this is always my preference as I dislike in your face perfumes and find them unattractive. I feel like a perfume should always be worn for oneself to make one feel a certain way and not to pungently announce someone or their personality. Tam Dao EDP keeps it intimate and subtle, yet still there and buildable, it makes me feel serene and confidant for myself. My favourite perfume discovery. &lt;3</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1495175"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1495175#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1490328" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; But so far im loving one I have in hand, jst so unique.<br />
<br />
I have to agree, Tam Dao is an elegant sandalwood perfume. Yes it is dry but u would picked up somethg beautiful at the back. Its mellow and creamy, i bet tat is the Vanilla and Ginger which make this Unisex in a way tho its leaning more to masculine side<br />
<br />
Suitable more to indoor/closed environment and I do believe it suited all wheather. Not must have but definitely worth checking - glad I tried this, I hope it help</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1490285"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1490285#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1483230" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1483230" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jellisunc"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1007550"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1007550.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jellisunc" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Wood-Sage-Sea-Salt-25529.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25529.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Wood Sage & Sea Salt"title="Wood Sage & Sea Salt"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1483230ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1483230" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1007550">jellisunc</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-14">01/14/22 14:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This stuff is phenomenal. Really nice dry woody offering that is given an extra oomph with cedar.<br />
<br />
I love sandalwood, probably my favorite note (as of lately). This will most likely replace Santal 33 for me because its so much better to my nose. Its dry and woody, but so easy to wear. This is dry, but also a bit powdery which I think helps round it out.<br />
<br />
This a great fragrance and would be an awesome signature scent if I could ever force myself to do that.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1483230"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1483230#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1474230" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1470010" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Faris.n"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1404883"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1404883.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Faris.n" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1470010ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1470010" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1404883">Faris.n</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-12-25">12/25/21 08:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a very beautiful elegant sandalwood fragrance. The performance is very low, unfortunately !! BTW, this fragrance made my nose go blind lol I don't know why.<br />
Anyway, I recommend this for perfume collectors only.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1470010"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1470010#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1464783" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1464783" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="everybodyhateschris"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1305320"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1305320.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="everybodyhateschris" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1464783ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1464783" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1305320">everybodyhateschris</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-12-16">12/16/21 16:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tam Dao is probably my favourite scent ever. It was my first niche fragrance over 10 years ago and it blew me away back then. Such an interesting and unique blend of woody, pencil shaving esque notes with a fresh and green, foresty feel. However, I noticed a few years back that although I still love Tam Dao, something was slightly different.<br />
<br />
I reached out to Dyptique to do some digging after I realised the version of Tam Dao I originally fell in love with was actually in the original square bottle design. It turns out there was actually a reformulation and I wasnt going crazy! They were kind enough to disclose that the original notes (2003) were myrtle, sandalwood, cedar and most importantly - and a bit surprisingly - ambergris. The reformulation now has cypress instead of ambergris :(<br />
<br />
So I say all that to say, Tam Dao is still a great fragrance. But in my opinion the original formulation was one of the best fragrances Ive ever smelt and - from memory - had way better sillage and was longer lasting. Such a shame!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1464783"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1464783#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1463742" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1463742" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JasonNewton"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/823807"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.823807.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JasonNewton" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/Amyris-Homme-Extrait-de-Parfum-59744.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.59744.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Amyris Homme Extrait de Parfum"title="Amyris Homme Extrait de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1463742ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1463742" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);
