Longevity and projection are pretty poor for the price. Regretfully, I blind bought this. I won't be bothering with Diptyque again.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1463742"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1463742#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1460366" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1460366" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CTH"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1245121"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1245121.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CTH" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Aramis/Tobacco-Reserve-50564.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50564.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tobacco Reserve"title="Tobacco Reserve"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1460366ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1460366" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1245121">CTH</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-12-09">12/09/21 09:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I found this to be a non complex linear sandalwood scent, its does smell very nice in fact it is beautiful but is is so intimate. The performance with my olive skin is not good sadly, there are much better options for sandalwood fragrance out there.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1460366"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1460366#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1457056" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1457056" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="eddiej"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1423198"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="eddiej" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1457056ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1457056" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1423198">eddiej</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-12-04">12/04/21 01:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like johnson&amp;johnson baby lotion to me which is a no no.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1457056"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1457056#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1453287" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1453287" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rowan.walters"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/568553"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.568553.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="rowan.walters" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/24-rue-de-l-Universite-47671.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47671.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="24 rue de l'Universit"title="24 rue de l'Universit"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1453287ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1453287" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/568553">rowan.walters</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-27">11/27/21 09:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Everyone who loves sandalwood responds favourably to Tam Dao, even though it's almost like a composite accord of fragrant woods lincluding cedar and palisander that enhances the impression of sandalwood. <br />
The EDP also has Amberwood (an aroma chemical also known as "Bois Ambrne Forte"). <br />
Definitely a crowd pleaser - never met anyone who didn't like it. <br />
<br />
Tam Dao is a beautiful, rich and multifaceted - but linear - sandalwood that pleases pretty much everyone who loves sandalwood because it's just so incredibly, intoxicatingly beautiful. It's an indulgent sandalwood sensory experience that is effectively a linear, single note fragrance that scratches the itch of every sandalwood lover yet doesn't conform to the conventions of traditional perfumery - it's not a fougre, chypre or oriental. <br />
It just is. <br />
<i>Very Zen</i><br />
<br />
Tam Dao reminds me of the carved sandalwood fans my parents had brought back from Ceylon that we used to play with as kids. This smells like actual sandalwood in its woody form, and does so in a way that feels "pure". <br />
Tam Dao was originally described as containing "Goa sandalwood" - not sure exactly what that means. There are four sandalwood varieties native to India, (and seven to Australia) so perhaps it's one of those. Goa is a former Portuguese territory on the West Coast of India, hugely popular with Westerners since the 1960s.<br />
<br />
Tam Dao is a tribute to the sacred aspect of sandalwood - like Killian's Sacred Wood, Tam Dao captures the essence of the fragrant wood that has been burned in temples and offered to the gods for thousands of years, in Egypt, Rome, Persia, India, China and Japan, <br />
<br />
It's the sacred connotations of the sandalwood in Tam Dao that makes it feel serene, meditative and contemplative - it evokes the image of a Buddhist temple, and perhaps it's that implication of spirituality that causes Tam Dao to transcend conventions of male and female to be truly and unequivocally unisex<br />
<br />
The EDP is an improvement on the performance of the EDT - above average but not epic, and longevity is best in Winter, six to eight hours. <br />
<br />
Tam Dao really is "serenity in a bottle". <br />
A really cool bottle. <br />
<br />
Tam Dao is a fragrance whose accolades are well-deserved. <br />
The EDT was a masterpiece, although its suboptimal performance was frustrating so when the EDP came out it was the Holy Grail. <br />
Like all Diptyque fragrances it is a work of art and a thing of beauty. <br />
<br />
An incredible fragrance, every wear is an epiphany.<br />
This belongs in the collection of everyone who loves sandalwood.<br />
Love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1453287"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1453287#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1451193" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1451193" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sopelka"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1150922"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="sopelka" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfum-d-Empire/Un-Bel-Amour-D-ete-90980.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.90980.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Un Bel Amour Dt"title="Un Bel Amour Dt"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1451193ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1451193" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1150922">sopelka</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-23">11/23/21 17:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is serenity in a bottle. I dont find it too much of any note. Someone below mentioned that there is nothing off-putting or unwelcome in this scent, and I agree. The main reason I love Tam Dao EDP is because despite being a definitely woody fragrance, it also smells creamy, and even somewhat chocolaty, which I have not experienced before.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1451193"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1451193#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1447526" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1447526" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kaylovely"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1329847"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1329847.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kaylovely" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Alexandre-J/Zafeer-Oud-Vanille-22361.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.22361.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Zafeer Oud Vanille"title="Zafeer Oud Vanille"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1447526ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1447526" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1329847">Kaylovely</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-17">11/17/21 12:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you like this try paper + from commodity way better smoother. May be lighter in silage but by a small fraction compared to cost.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1447526"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1447526#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1436407" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1436407" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SANDYDE"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1333705"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1333705.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SANDYDE" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Stephane-Humbert-Lucas-777/Black-Gemstone-18312.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18312.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Gemstone"title="Black Gemstone"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1436407ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1436407" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1333705">SANDYDE</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-28">10/28/21 20:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Im always disappointed in diptyque, yet I keep falling for the hype. Their candles are fantastic, but their perfumes (and I only buy the EDPs) suck in performance. They are crowd pleasers, for sure, and never push any real boundaries. best sandalwood on the market you say? How can you possibly get to know it when you have about 15 min to try to enjoy it before it disappears. This will be my last diptyque purchase, I dont care what. Id even go back to santal 33, before wearing this. At least youd have a good few hours to smell like everyone else. Im exaggerating slightly, but the sentiment is 100% accurate. Total bummer.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1436407"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1436407#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1428515" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1428515" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alyllauren"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1382355"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1382355.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alyllauren" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Hermessence-Ambre-Narguile-2669.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2669.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hermessence Ambre Narguile"title="Hermessence Ambre Narguile"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1428515ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1428515" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1382355">alyllauren</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-15">10/15/21 06:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is the platonic ideal of woody scents in my opinion. A true, photo-realistic portrait of a crisp winter forest without any twists or notes out of place. Straightforward and reliable. On my skin, I only really get the cedar, sandalwood, coriander and musk. There's a little bit of projection in the first hour maybe, but after that it sits pretty close to the skin. I got between 6 and 7 hours of wear before this scent is gone.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1428515"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1428515#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1422332" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1422332" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JmThms"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1293565"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1293565.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JmThms" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Escada/Escada-pour-Homme-1364.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1364.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Escada pour Homme"title="Escada pour Homme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1422332ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1422332" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1293565">JmThms</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-04">10/04/21 17:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Just an hour into my first test wear of this and its true: Tam Dao is the first word and last word in woody fragrances. For me, Tam Dao is to wood what Tom Ford Ombr Leather is to leather. Pretty photorealistic. If Guerlain Heritage is my Grandfather's cedar chest full of old, vintage documents, photographs, and memorabilia interlaced with spices and dried herbal leaves and twigs, all in a creamy lavender bed, then Tam Dao is the cedar chest itself. And very wearable. Fantastic.<br />
But what is the deal with the poor performance of Diptyque fragrances?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1422332"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1422332#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1417867" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1417867" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ckorp8"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1357605"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1357605.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ckorp8" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/M-Micallef/Delice-40561.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40561.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Delice"title="Delice"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1417867ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1417867" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1357605">ckorp8</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-27">09/27/21 07:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Blind bought this and By Kilian Straight to Heaven and learned that I dont actually like woody scent that much. The perfume is purely just wood scent and not at all enjoyable to me. And I thought that since I love TF Oud Wood maybe I ought to like these as well. Will have to layer these with other perfumes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1417867"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1417867#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1415345" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1415345" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="The Wolf"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1263755"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1263755.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="The Wolf" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Bois-D-Argent-48396.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48396.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bois D'Argent"title="Bois D'Argent"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1415345ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1415345" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1263755">The Wolf</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-22">09/22/21 19:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wow, this is stunning. Ive tried hundreds of fragrances and I'm not sure why I waited on this one.<br />
This is one of the best woody fragrances I've ever put my nose on.<br />
<br />
It wasn't completely off my radar because I smelled it a few years back on a test strip.<br />
But this belongs on skin. And on my skin, it blooms into a beautiful sandalwood/cedarwood concoction that is just nothing short of outstanding.<br />
<br />
Other reviewers have said this has meditative qualities and I completely agree.<br />
In addition to the wood there is a turpentine/wood seal quality that I love.<br />
<br />
I want to smell like this all the time.<br />
Unfortunately, Santal 33 (my current wood fragrance champion) beats this handily on the performance front.<br />
I love both frags but in different ways.<br />
<br />
Stunning, mesmerizing, masterpiece.<br />
This has real WOW factor. <br />
<br />
Smell. 10/10<br />
Performance 5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1415345"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1415345#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1407239" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1407239" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kittyharlan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1372608"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1372608.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="kittyharlan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Marissa-Zappas/Maggie-the-Cat-is-Alive-I-m-Alive-83244.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.83244.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Maggie the Cat is Alive! Im Alive!"title="Maggie the Cat is Alive! Im Alive!"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1407239ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1407239" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1372608">kittyharlan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-09">09/09/21 10:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Oh, yum. I cant get enough. <br />
<br />
Put off trying this gem for quite some time bc Im not a huge Diptyque fan and I find the marketing for and buzz around TD to be old school orientalist and I dont want to smell like that. Thankfully, TD doesnt. <br />
<br />
Reminds me so perfectly of the sandalwood essential oil I used to buy at the hippie dippy metaphysical store and wear in high school. Pure, creamy, delicious sandalwood, dried out and textured a bit by photographic portrait of cedar sawdust. The lime, coriander, ginger really come through on me and liven/lighten this up enough that Im comfortable wearing it any time, anywhere, and musk and vanilla come in just a bit later to secure some warmth, sex, and comfort through the zingy aromatics. No surprises as this unfolds, nothing unwelcome makes an appearance. An absolute beauty start to finish. Perfectly balanced. Incredibly well crafted. <br />
<br />
Minimal sillage on me, a pleasant little skin scent but thankfully not quite a secret. Ill be overspraying bc I lose it every two hours but its worth it to me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1407239"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1407239#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1402208" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1402208" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TheBoyToy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1247579"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1247579.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TheBoyToy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/Le-Male-430.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.430.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Le Male"title="Le Male"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1402208ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1402208" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1247579">TheBoyToy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-31">08/31/21 18:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like authentic freshly chopped cedar tree which is supported by sandalwood that gives it a sort of creaminess. A very pleasant scent that just feels very cozy and festive. Wish it lasted longer and projected a bit more.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1402208"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1402208#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1402047" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1402047" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Eribert"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1302689"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1302689.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Eribert" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1402047ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1402047" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1302689">Eribert</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-31">08/31/21 12:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tam Dao is a pleasant fragrance. It smells exactly like freshly-cut wood chops, which evokes all sorts of lovely memories within me.<br />
<br />
The EdT starts off slightly sour and reminds me of lighter wood, whereas the EdP beginns deep and dark which I prefer. Both develop into a soothing, soft sandalwood-stage where they rest with little change through the end.<br />
<br />
Unfortunately, after only about 3 hours, even the EdP becomes a skin-scent. After 5 hours, there is only the faintest trace left at all.<br />
<br />
I was testing Tam Dao as a contender to replace CdG's Wonderwood - with which I also have longevity-issues - as my to-go wood fragrance. Considering that, Tam Dao could not convince me. However, I think that especially the EdP- version is a good option if you are looking for something entirely different from Wonderwood. Tam Dao is not complex, it doesn't give you that WOW- effect, but it is simple and relaxing. It does not have any spa-notes which you oftentimes find in woody fragrances, but feels more like staying overnight at a wooden cottage in the mountains. Also, I find it to be introvert-but-slightly-sexy, which is a rather rare combination. <br />
<br />
Tam Dao is entirely unisex - although I think it might be more attractive on a woman - and should work on people from their mid-20s onwards. I fully recommend it - although personally I think I will stick with Wonderwood...<br />
<br />
<br />
TL;DR: freshly-cut wood chops, longevity issues</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1402047"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1402047#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1397495" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1397495" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ambergeese"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1348862"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1348862.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ambergeese" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nasomatto/Baraonda-40200.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40200.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Baraonda"title="Baraonda"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1397495ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1397495" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1348862">ambergeese</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-23">08/23/21 10:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>At first whiff, this is a loud, peppery scratch-and-sniff gingerbread kitchen. As a child, I had a scratch-and-sniff book about Christmas smells, with berries and jams and spearmint and gingerbread to sniff. The initial sweet-yet-too-loud-and-sharp blast of Tam Dao EDP brings me right back to the gingerbread house page of that book.<br />
<br />
On me, the coriander (and perhaps some nuance of the cedar, although I don't quite smell something I'd call cedar throughout) makes for a slightly screechy, too-spicy, too-loud opening. It calms down gradually, though; the gingerbread kitchen gets more real by the minute. The sweetness of the vanilla comes out more and more, playing with the sandalwood and ginger to create a scent that's almost gourmand, but just a bit too woody to eat. It's like you're holding a delicious-looking gingersnap cookie that you're not entirely sure isn't a finely-crafted scented wooden fabrication.<br />
<br />
The aforementioned sharpness of coriander and cedar, as well as the woody nuances, keep this from being too tasty, but it's still plenty mouth-watering. This is a sandalwood for gourmand lovers. I haven't smelled genuine mysore, so I can't comment on the many remarks of how similar Tam Dao EDP is, but this is scrumptious. On me, the sandalwood is gentle and very evenly blended in with ginger, such that I can't quite tell where each ends and begins, how much is edible and how much is wooden. This is cuddly and moderately woody-sweet without being cloying.<br />
<br />
The performance, longevity, and sillage are poor, particularly for an EDP. The fragrance is lovely, but it's a skin scent on me just about instantly and is gone in three hours. Considering the price of a Diptyque EDP, and that performance... this is not at all worth the price point for me. I'll absolutely enjoy the rest of my sample, though; I plan to save it for colder weather and see how it performs.<br />
<br />
Exacerbated, perhaps, by hot weather, something in the late drydown turns dusty, corky, an unsweet library shelf sort of wood. I like it, but I imagine the overall warmth and sweetness of this scent (along with its longevity) survive better in cold weather.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1397495"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1397495#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1394023" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1394023" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kcoughlin"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1344087"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1344087.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="kcoughlin" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nest/Wild-Poppy-53153.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53153.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Wild Poppy"title="Wild Poppy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1394023ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1394023" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7); Woody and warm and spicy. It's quite lovely!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1394023"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1394023#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1392891" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; <br />
A quite straightforward woody fragrance, smells natural and pure. Very nice.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1388155"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1388155#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1387144" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Completely natural smelling, no sharp synthetics here. Cut logs after rain. Hypnotic, mythic, and spicy. Supposedly also contains ginger, lime, vanilla etc but I can only smell them very faintly.<br />
An Ok scent, but it wears off quickly and probably isn't worth the price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1376363"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1376363#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1357658" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1357658" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Alexandrarosario"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1343613"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1343613.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Alexandrarosario" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1357658ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1357658" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1343613">Alexandrarosario</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-10">06/10/21 08:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have the EDP. The smell is super wonderful. I LOVE IT SO MUCH. Its like a burnt leaves/wood, any kind of insence, warm, and very very woody. I like it. Somehow, it reminds me a lot of Bvlgari - Men In Black, i dont know why but it has quite the same scent! But Tam Dao is softer and quite smoky, while the Bvlgari one more spicy and balsamic. If i can describe the smell, i imagine my self living in an old cabin, alone in the middle of the tranquil woods. Listening to the quiet sound of the woods, the cracks of leaves, and the wind while cleaning up, burning up leaves and woods, and preparing for dinner on the evening. The projection and sillage in me is very intimate, the longevity stays around 2 hours, or maybe a little less than 3 hours if i put a little bit more on my skin. It becomes skin scents in few minutes. I wish this perfume has greater SPL. Also, I kinda agree with some people that said its quite meditative.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1357658"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1357658#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1357455" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1357455" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rowan.walters"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/568553"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.568553.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="rowan.walters" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/24-rue-de-l-Universite-47671.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47671.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="24 rue de l'Universit"title="24 rue de l'Universit"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1357455ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1357455" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/568553">rowan.walters</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-09">06/09/21 23:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Mmm this is SO GOOD. <br />
It really is heavenly. <br />
A unique sandalwood fragrance of superlative quality,<br />
<br />
As others have mentioned, Tam Dao has a meditative feeling - it is an olfactory experience akin to meditation, a sensory tribute that subtly highlights and enhances the most beautiful elements of sandalwood into an elegant mosaic of fragrant woods with breathtakingly beautiful woody and creamy aspects.<br />
<br />
Tam Dao is subtly different from other Santalum Album fragrances, insofar as it evokes the sandalwood of East Asia rather than South Asia, (or Japan, rather than India) - possibly due to the influence of the Cedar and the aroma chemical Amberwood (aka Bois Ambrene Forte) and, maybe Im mistaken, but I seem to recall that the original Tam Dao EDT also contained Rosewood.<br />
<br />
In any case Tam Dao reminds me of temples in Kyoto.<br />
As a sandalwood obsessive this is one of my all-time favourite fragrances, and imparts an aura of serenity.<br />
<br />
For lovers of Sandalwood this is highly recommended and a very safe blind buy, wearable by men and women, and guaranteed to please.<br />
<br />
As a fan of the EDT I had high expectations of the EDP - and although sublime, this wondrous elixir would be utterly perfect if only its longevity were greater.<br />
<br />
Longevity can be improved by applying it over a fond de parfum of sandalwood essential oil or high quality attar. <br />
Indra Sugandh has a beautiful Mysore Sandalwood attar that works really well with Tam Dao. <br />
<br />
Tam Dao is exquisitely beautiful - one of the best sandalwood fragrances ever, an experience that highlights the most beautiful  aspects of Indian Sandalwood.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1357455"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1357455#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1336981" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It's meditative, addictive and utterly beautiful!! Most authentic sandalwood fragrance I sniffed till to date!! <br />
I don't know about poor performance which few are complaining!! On my skin the performance is just excellent!! I find this projecting even after four hours mark!! Projects smoothly in controlled condition but pops in heat...simply stunning!!<br />
10/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1336981"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1336981#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1334188" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1207813">tukangciumparfum</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-28">04/28/21 22:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tam Dao EDP is really a gem with that woody resinous slightly sweet sandalwood that is really pleasant and soft. <br />
The performance is very close to the skin after a mere 30 minutes. It really smells like a rich person's home somewhere in Los Angeles or a high end Japanese temple that is reserved for the elites. If you are a gamer you can definitely picture the Senpou Temple level in the game SEKIRO if you smell this. This fragrance definitely can be worn casually everyday as your signature scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1334188"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1334188#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1327004" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Very comforting and elegant, almost with a cold but still very cuddly aura. Unfortunately this disappear on me after 30 minutes, from then on it a weak skin scent, for 6 hours though. Really sad. I would be so happy to smell like the opening forever. I want this scent with better projection and longevity. I would buy a bottle anyway, if I could get it for a nice price. I really want it, even though it has to be reapplied. PS: I actually get more projection of this in fall and winter.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1327004"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1327004#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1320684" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; The scent of string players.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1320684"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1320684#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1320563" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1320563" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="L.bss"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1207600"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="L.bss" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Capitale-Eau-de-Parfum-58391.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.58391.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Capitale Eau de Parfum"title="Eau Capitale Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1320563ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1320563" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1207600">L.bss</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-06">04/06/21 13:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Boy if this is good. Now you need to really like the scent of a piece of spruce wood.  It starts with a very high dose of Iso E super or something similar on a bed of javenol, its not so creamy but almost spicy (i guess thats the coriander but isoesuper is also quite peppery lets face it) With this I am not saying it smells synthetic but it reminds me of those molecules. I absolutely love it! It smells of a wooden chalet, the inside of a steaming hot sauna, woodchippings. Drydown is the best because i finally get the lime which adds this quirkiness, the olfactive accident I guess. Vanilla is there  to reinforce sandalwood and add some depth. I am not sure what amberwood smells like but anytime i see it listed theres some sharpness and incredible longevity added to the fragrance ( I am thinking to L'homme a la rose MFK). Going to comparisons there was a moment (having tam dao in one hand and gypsy water in the other) in the beginning of the drydown which they almost smelled identical but opening and drydown are in completely opposite directions. Tam Dao is a fulfilling 360 degrees woody experience (actual dry bark guys) whereas gypsy water goes citrusy and and somehow sweet. If you are searching for something like Gypsy water <br />
i suggest Tulsivivah! from Miller et Berteaux which is a super happy and comforting sandalwood with oranges and lemon, that fragrance really needs more attention and love because its great! 10 out of 10 Diptyque again, never a disappointment<br />
<br />
in fact the accident is mirtle, which makes sense it enhances the smell of sandalwood. Last thing I promise, i dont get the name. Or I mean this could have to do with what we associate with smells, because of what i said I would think this as a very western oriented fragrance and instead it is made thinking to asian forests. Just great how we come to things from completely opposite angles of perspective</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1320563"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1320563#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1314038" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1314038" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="huet82"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1246883"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="huet82" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49104.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tam Dao Eau de Parfum"title="Tam Dao Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1314038ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1314038" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1246883">huet82</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-25">03/25/21 17:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wow, this is absolutely lovely. I've tried only the EDT before, but this one while retaining the same features, brings something new into the mix too. Both are very much unisex, and while neither has great sillage, this has a bit better longevity. If the EDT is heavy on the cedar all the way through and feels a little cold, this one also brings something warm, spicy, and lovely into the mix. I can't describe it in full, but it's absolutely full-bottle worthy for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="49104"comment_id="1314038"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html?ccid=1314038#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="49104" sentiment="all"></reviews-infinity>
